SHE’S A LOYAL RED CROSS WORKER
Miss Marie McLaughlin, the young woman shown above, is
one of the active campaigners for the ambulance fund col-
lected by the Fotterall Square Red Cross.
AS FINE A BUNCH OF LADS AS EVER DONNED THE KHAKI

These are student aviators of the Cornell Aviation Camp. Philadelphians will recognize “Ted” Meredith, the fleet-footed Penn runner of yesteryear, the third man
left side in the first row. Next on his right is the son of Senator Oliver, and the sixth man from the left in the third row is Sergeant F. L. Koons, of Wynnewood.
of these men have left for Mount Clemens, Mich., for their final intensive trainirg before going to France.
KIDDIES ROMP IN GLEE ON BIG RIVER PIER
During the hot summer days children living near the Race
street pier on the Delaware get much enjoyment by playin

there in fresh air and sunshine. This picture was snap
during a recent carnival.

the rolling waves.
